10-2-6: DANGEROUS, INCOMPLETE OR ABANDONED BUILDINGS:
Dangerous or unsafe buildings or uncompleted and abandoned buildings within the
corporate limits of the village are hereby declared to be a nuisance and shall
be remediated, abated or otherwise addressed in the manner set forth in title
5, chapter 1, article A of this code. (Ord. 2009-09, 2-2-2009)
10-2-7: BROKEN WINDOWS AND LIGHT FIXTURES; BOARDED UP PREMISES:
   A.   Every window, glazed exterior door, exterior transom or exterior
sidelight shall be provided with properly installed glass or other approved
glazing material. In the event of breakage, the owner shall cause the immediate
removal of broken glass from the premises and shall temporarily board up the
affected openings with suitable material to provide protection from the
elements and to prevent entry of insects, birds or animals and to provide
security to occupants or contents of the building.
   B.   Adequate ventilation and artificial lighting shall be provided for all
occupied dwellings, dwelling units, rooming units, hotels or motels. Whenever
any exterior openings are found boarded up, it shall be the duty of the
appropriate village official to notify the owner or agent of this requirement
by giving him a period of not more than ten (10) working days in which to
properly replace the broken glass in the dwelling unit, rooming unit, dwelling,
hotel or motel, or said dwelling unit, rooming unit, dwelling, hotel or motel
shall be vacated. This notice shall be given in the manner required by
subsection 10-2-4B of this chapter, and it shall be unlawful for any owner or
agent to fail to comply with the order of the village official contained in
such notice.
   C.   Since the presence of boarded up buildings, particularly those where
the boarding is unpainted or applied in an insecure, careless or unpresentable
fashion, invites vandalism and creates a blighting influence which adversely
affects the general welfare of the people of the village, it is hereby required
that all boarding up of exterior openings be accomplished in a neat,
workmanlike manner with not less than one-half inch (1/2") thick, weather
resistant plywood, cut to fit within openings, fastened in place as securely as
possible and suitably coated with an appropriate neutral color blending with or
harmonizing with the exterior colors of the building as inconspicuously as
possible. It shall be the duty of the appropriate village official to notify
the owner or agent of any boarded up dwelling, dwelling unit, rooming unit,
hotel or motel not complying with the above requirements of the necessity of
compliance by giving him a period of not more than ten (10) working days in
which to replace the broken glass or in which to repair, replace or paint the
boarding. This notice shall be given in the manner required in subsection 10-2-
4B of this chapter, and it shall be unlawful for any owner or agent to fail to
comply with the order of the village official contained in such notice. (Ord.
2009-09, 2-2-2009)
10-2-8: EMERGENCY MEASURES:
   A.   When any dwelling unit, rooming unit, dwelling, hotel or motel has
become so damaged by fire, wind or other causes, or has become so unsafe,
unhealthful or unsanitary that, in the opinion of the appropriate village
official, life or health is immediately endangered by the occupation of the
dwelling, dwelling unit, rooming unit, hotel or motel, the said village
official is hereby authorized and empowered to revoke without notice any
occupancy permits for such structures, dwellings, dwelling units, rooming
units, hotels or motels, and to order and require the occupants to vacate the
same forthwith, and to order the owner or agent to proceed immediately with the
corrective work and repairs required to make the dwelling, dwelling unit,
rooming unit, hotel or motel temporarily safe and fit for human habitation,
whether or not a notice of violation has been given as described in this
chapter, and whether or not legal procedures described by ordinances of the
village have been instituted. It shall be unlawful for any person to fail to
comply with any emergency order of the village.
   B.   Whenever the appropriate village official finds that an emergency
exists which requires immediate action to protect the health and safety of the
residents or of the public, he may issue an order citing the existence of an
emergency and require immediate action to be taken as deemed necessary to meet
the emergency. Notwithstanding other provisions of this chapter, such order
shall take effect immediately. (Ord. 2009-09, 2-2-2009)
10-2-9: VIOLATION; PENALTIES:
   A.   It shall be unlawful for any owner, occupant or agent of the same to
occupy premises within the village and permit any of the conditions enumerated
herein, which are declared a nuisance, to exist.
   B.   Any person, firm or corporation or other business entity found in
violation of this chapter shall be subject to a fine of not less than fifty
dollars ($50.00) nor more than seven hundred fifty dollars ($750.00) for each
offense. A separate offense shall be deemed committed on each day the violation
continues.
   C.   Should a violation of this chapter be found, any occupancy or building
permit issued by the village for the property in violation may be revoked or a
stop work order may be issued by the appropriate administrating official of the
village. (Ord. 2009-09, 2-2-2009)
CHAPTER 3
BUILDING PERMITS
SECTION:
10-3-1: Short Title
10-3-2: Purpose And Intent
10-3-3: Applicability
10-3-4: Submittal Requirements
10-3-5: Building Permit Review Process
10-3-6: Additional Permitting
10-3-7: Expiration Of Building Permit
10-3-8: Responsibility For Damage
10-3-9: Violations And Penalties
10-3-10: Fee Structure
10-3-1: SHORT TITLE:
This chapter shall be known as the BUILDING PERMITS ORDINANCE of the Village of
Heyworth. (Ord. 2015-07, 2-5-2015)
10-3-2: PURPOSE AND INTENT:
The purpose of this chapter is to promote the health, safety and general
welfare of the Village of Heyworth, including the protection of the citizens
and the preservation of the character and structures of the Village, by
establishing minimum requirements and regulations governing the erection,
movement, reconstruction or alteration of any building or structure. (Ord.
2015-07, 2-5-2015)
10-3-3: APPLICABILITY:
   A.   Building Permit Required: A building permit shall be required prior to
commencement of certain demolition or construction related activities which may
include, but is not limited to, the following improvements:
      1.   Demolitions;
      2.   Building additions;
      3.   Any modification of a load bearing wall;
      4.   Porches, decks, and patios;
      5.   Fences, pergolas, and gazebos;
      6.   Pools and hot tubs (excluding wading/kiddie pools);
      7.   Accessory structures fifty (50) square feet or more;
      8.   Solar panel installations
      9.   Roof/Shingle installations or replacements; or
      10.   All structures intended for occupancy.
   B.   Building Permit Not Required: A building permit is not required, but
may be issued at no charge if requested by the owner, for the following
activities:
      1.   Interior remodeling, plumbing or electrical alterations that are
less than 50% of the fair market value of the property;
      2.   Residing or replacement of windows or doors that do not require
enlargement of the opening size;
      3.   Sheds without a permanent foundation and less than fifty (50) square
feet;
      4.   Items that are maintenance in nature and not otherwise specified as
requiring a building permit.
(Ord. 2015-07, 2-5-2015; amd. Ord. 2024-20, 4-18-2024)
10-3-4: SUBMITTAL REQUIREMENTS:
   A.   In order for a building permit to be issued, the owner/applicant shall
submit the completed "Building Permit & Plan Examination Application" and any
applicable fees to the Village of Heyworth. Refer to section
10-3-10 of this chapter for the fee structure. Checks shall be made payable to
the "Village of Heyworth".
   B.   Plans or plans and specifications shall be submitted for all structures
intended for occupancy. (Ord. 2015-07, 2-5-2015)
10-3-5: BUILDING PERMIT REVIEW PROCESS:
   A.   Administration: The designated administrating official shall administer
the review of the "Building Permit & Plan Examination Application" and any
accompanying plans and specifications. (Ord. 2015-07, 2-5-2015)
   B.   Engineering Review: The Village Engineer shall review plans for
improvements in areas zoned Commercial or Industrial or for residential multi-
family structures of five (5) or more units. The Village Engineer is not
responsible for performing surveys or locating or determining lot dimensions
for applicants. (Ord. 2016-38, 9-15-2016)
   C.   Building Code Compliance Review: All plans and specifications shall be
reviewed for compliance with the building regulations established by chapter 1
of this title by the administrating official, or in the event that an
administrating official is not designated, a copy of the plans and
specifications shall be maintained in the Office of the Village Clerk.
   D.   Processing Request: Review of the "Building Permit & Plan Examination
Application" and any accompanying plans and specifications shall be completed
within fourteen (14) calendar days of their receipt.
      1.   All applicants are responsible for adhering to any applicable
restrictive covenants, easements, or any other applicable restriction,
regulation, or law affiliated with the property.
   E.   Display Of Approved Permits: Approved building permits shall be
displayed in a location on the construction site that is visible from the
street.
   F.   Inspection/Reinspection: The administrating official is authorized and
empowered to enter upon any premises for the purpose of inspecting the same for
compliance with the building regulations established by provisions of this
title. After completion of the structure requested to be constructed with the
permit, the owner or applicant shall notify the administrating official for
final inspection. Upon final inspection, if the premises and structure are
constructed in compliance with the permit, the administration official shall
provide a certificate of compliance, also referred to as a use permit. If the
premises is found to be in violation of any of the provisions of this chapter,
the owner of the property shall be subject to the penalties set forth in
section
10-3-9 of this chapter. If the premises are found to be in violation, the
administrating official may require reinspection for verification of compliance
after such violations are found. If the premises are found to be in violation
after reinspection and further reinspection is necessary to verify compliance,
each reinspection after the first reinspection shall be at a charge of twenty-
five dollars ($25.00) per reinspection. Such reinspection charge shall be due
prior to issuance of a use or occupancy permit.
   G.   Compliance: Any approved building permit or approval after inspection
by the Village does not alleviate compliance of any law or give affirmation of
compliance with any law related to Building Codes or any other item relevant to
the building permit.
   H.   Monthly Reports: At the first regularly scheduled Board meeting of
every month, the Administrative Officer shall provide a monthly report to the
Board of Trustees of all building permits issued by the Village.
(Ord. 2015-07, 2-5-2015; amd. Ord. 2024-20, 4-18-2024)
10-3-6: ADDITIONAL PERMITTING:
   A.   Excavation/Utility/Curb Cut: If applicable, the owner/applicant shall
apply for the "Excavation/Utility/Curb Cut Permit Application" and receive the
necessary permits prior to the commencement of construction. Refer to chapter 4
of this title for the requirements of excavation/utility/curb cut permits.
   B.   Permit For Occupancy: Occupancy of any structure within the Village
limits shall be prohibited unless a permit for occupancy has been applied for
and issued by the Village of Heyworth. Refer to chapter 5 of this title for the
requirements of occupancy permits.
   C.   Additional Requirements: It is the responsibility of the owner to
satisfy any additional permitting requirements of the Village of Heyworth and
of other relevant permitting authorities and to pay all costs associated with
obtaining the necessary approvals to construct the proposed improvements. (Ord.
2015-07, 2-5-2015)
10-3-7: EXPIRATION OF BUILDING PERMIT:
Building permits shall expire at the end of one year or as noted on the permit
unless work has not begun within six (6) months of issuance or if work is
suspended or abandoned, then building permits shall expire six (6) months from
the date of issuance if work has not yet begun or six (6) months from the date
that work is suspended or abandoned if the one year expiration period has not
or will not have elapsed from the date of issuance at the expiration of the six
(6) months. A six (6) month extension of a permit may be granted for an
additional fee of fifty dollars ($50.00). (Ord. 2015-07, 2-5-2015)
10-3-8: RESPONSIBILITY FOR DAMAGE:
The owner shall be responsible for all contractors that are performing
construction activities on subject property and any damage that might be caused
to the streets, curb and gutters, sidewalks, and line and grade of ditches and
sewer. The owner shall be responsible to repair any damages to the satisfaction
of the Village of Heyworth. If the owner has not completed the repair within
three (3) months after notice to repair has been issued, the Village of
Heyworth may complete the repair at the expense of the property owner. (Ord.
2015-07, 2-5-2015)
10-3-9: VIOLATIONS AND PENALTIES:
   A.   It shall be a violation of this chapter for any person to knowingly or
with reckless disregard for the truth or veracity make any false statement or
statements or provide inaccurate plans and specifications in the "Building
Permit & Plan Examination Application". If a permit is issued in reliance upon
an inaccurate "Building Permit & Plan Examination Application" the appropriate
administrating official may issue a stop work order and/or revoke the building
permit issued.
   B.   In case of a violation of any provision of this chapter, the applicable
code official may cause to be instituted the appropriate proceeding at law or
in equity to obtain penalties or to restrain, correct or abate such violation,
or to require the removal or termination of an unlawful occupancy or
construction of the structure by issuance of a stop work order, revocation of
building permit or any other means permitted by law. The Village may take
action to abate any violation, and any costs incurred in abating such
violations may be charged against the real estate upon which such abatement
occurs and shall be a lien upon such property.
   C.   Any person who violates any of the provisions of this chapter shall be
subject to a fine of not less than one hundred fifty dollars ($150.00) nor more
than seven hundred fifty dollars ($750.00) for each violation. Each day upon
which a violation occurs shall be considered a separate and distinct offense.
(Ord. 2015-07, 2-5-2015; amd. Ord. 2024-20, 4-18-2024)
10-3-10: FEE STRUCTURE:
   A.   Basis For Fees: The fees assessed for building permits shall be
determined in accordance with the following:
      1.   The square footage of the improvements;
      2.   The applicability of plan review for a permit application. Refer to
section
10-3-5 of this chapter;
      3.   Whether or not certain Village offices established for the purpose
of plan review and/or inspection are currently vacant or filled. Refer to
subsections
10-3-5B, C, and F of this chapter; and
      4.   The valuation of the improvements. If the valuation of the
improvements is less than or equal to five hundred dollars ($500.00), the "plan
review fee" and/or the "inspection fee" may be waived.
   B.   Fee Timeline: The various building permit fees shall be due in
accordance with the following provisions:
      1.   The "plan review fee", if applicable, shall be due at the time that
plans are submitted. Refer to subsections
10-3-5B and C of this chapter for applicability.
      2.   The "permit fee" shall be due when the permit application/plans have
been approved and before a permit is issued.
      3.   The "inspection fee", if applicable, shall be due when the permit
application/plans have been approved and before a permit is issued. Refer to
subsection
10-3-5F of this chapter for applicability.
   C.   Fee Structure:
                    Plan Review Fee (If Applicable)     Inspection Fee (If

   D.   Refunds: Permit fees may be refundable subject to the following
circumstances:
      1.   There shall be no refunds on permit (application) fees.
      2.   Code review fees are refundable if the request for refund is prior

      3.   Fees for water meters, water/sewer tap fees, and onsite inspections
are refundable if the project is cancelled prior to the start of construction.
      4.   Once a permit is cancelled, a new permit must be applied for and
issued with new fees paid in order to restart the project.
   All requests for refunds must be made in writing to the Village code
official. Payments made by cash or check shall be refunded via check made to
the applicant after the next regular check run of the Village. Payments made by
credit card shall have any applicable refund made to the card less any card
processing fees. (Ord. 2015-07, 2-5-2015; amd. Ord. 2024-20, 4-18-2024; Ord.
2025-04, 1-23-2025)
CHAPTER 4
EXCAVATION/UTILITY/CURB CUT PERMITS
SECTION:
10-4-1: Short Title
10-4-2: Purpose And Intent
10-4-3: Permits Required
10-4-4: Submittal Requirements
10-4-5: Review Process
10-4-6: Additional Permits
10-4-7: Expiration Of Permit; Extensions
10-4-8: Responsibility For Damage
10-4-9: Fees
10-4-10: Violations; Penalties
10-4-1: SHORT TITLE:
This chapter shall be known as the EXCAVATION/UTILITY/CURB CUT PERMITS
ORDINANCE of the village. (Ord. 2009-03, 1-20-2009)
10-4-2: PURPOSE AND INTENT:
The purpose of this chapter is to promote the health, safety and general
welfare of the village, including the protection of the citizens and the
infrastructures of the village by establishing minimum requirements and
regulations governing the excavation of land, connections to the public water
and sewer systems, and cutting, alteration or removal of curbs, sidewalks and
streets located in village rights of way. (Ord. 2009-03, 1-20-2009)
10-4-3: PERMITS REQUIRED:
   A.   Excavation Permit; Exceptions: An excavation permit shall be required
prior to commencement of all demolition or construction related activities
except for the following activities:
      1.   Excavation or fill less than fifty (50) cubic yards, with less than
a four foot (4') cut and disturbing less than five thousand (5,000) square feet
on the site.
      2.   Any interior remodeling.
      3.   Additions, remodeling, or accessory structures smaller than five
hundred (500) square feet which disturb less than two thousand (2,000) square
feet on the site.
   B.   Utility Permit: A utility permit shall be required prior to any
connection of a private water service or sanitary sewer service to a public
water main or a public sewer main. See sections
9-1-4 and
9-4-13 of this code for the requirements of utility permits.
   C.   Curb Cut Permit: A curb cut permit shall be required prior to any cut
or removal of public curb and gutter, sidewalk, or street. Replacement of
sidewalk and street pavement by the village shall be at the applicant's/owner's
expense per the fee structure set out in section
10-4-9 of this chapter. Alternatively, the applicant/owner may replace the
sidewalk and street pavement under village supervision; however, the inspection
fee set out in section
10-4-9 of this chapter still applies. (Ord. 2009-03, 1-20-2009)
10-4-4: SUBMITTAL REQUIREMENTS:
   A.   To apply for an excavation/utility/curb cut permit, the owner/applicant
shall submit the completed excavation/utility/curb cut permit application and
any applicable fees to the village. See section
10-4-9 of this chapter for the fee structure. Checks shall be made payable to
the "Village of Heyworth".
   B.   As a requisite for approval of the excavation/utility/curb cut permit,
a sketch of the improvements or plans and specifications shall be submitted for
review. If a building permit is applied for concurrently with the excavation/
utility/curb cut permit application, the owner/applicant need not resubmit any
plans or sketches submitted as part of that application. (Ord. 2009-03, 1-20-
2009)
10-4-5: REVIEW PROCESS:
   A.   Administration: The superintendent of public works shall administer the
review of the excavation/utility/curb cut permit application and any
accompanying plans and specifications.
   B.   Engineer Review: The village engineer may, at the request of the
superintendent of public works, review sketches, plans, and/or specifications
for conformance of proposed work with the village design standards enumerated
elsewhere in this code. Otherwise, the review of all sketches, plans, and
specifications shall be performed by the village superintendent of public
works.
   C.   Processing Request: Review of the excavation/utility/curb cut permit
application and any accompanying plans and specifications shall be completed
within fourteen (14) calendar days of their receipt.
   D.   Inspection: It is the responsibility of the owner and/or applicant to
schedule all required inspections with the superintendent of public works at
least forty eight (48) hours prior to commencing the permitted work. (Ord.
2009-03, 1-20-2009)
10-4-6: ADDITIONAL PERMITS:
   A.   Occupancy Permit: Occupancy of any structure within the village limits
shall be prohibited unless a permit for occupancy has been applied for and
issued by the village. See chapter 5 of this title for the requirements for
permits for occupancy.
   B.   Additional Requirements: It is the responsibility of the owner and/or
applicant to satisfy any additional permitting requirements of the village and
of other relevant permitting authorities and to pay all costs associated with
obtaining the necessary approvals to construct the proposed improvements. (Ord.
2009-03, 1-20-2009)
10-4-7: EXPIRATION OF PERMIT; EXTENSIONS:
Excavation/utility/curb cut permits shall expire at the end of one year or as
noted on the permit unless work has not begun within six (6) months of
issuance, or if work is suspended or abandoned, then the excavation/utility/
curb cut permits shall expire six (6) months from the date of issuance if work
has not yet begun or six (6) months from the date that work is suspended or
abandoned if the one year expiration period has not or will not have elapsed
from the date of issuance at the expiration of the six (6) months. A six (6)
month extension of a permit may be granted for an additional fee of fifty
dollars ($50.00). (Ord. 2009-03, 1-20-2009)
10-4-8: RESPONSIBILITY FOR DAMAGE:
The owner shall be responsible for all contractors that are performing
construction activities on subject property and any damage that might be caused
to the streets, curb and gutters, sidewalks, and line and grade of ditches and
sewer. The owner shall be liable for the repair to the satisfaction of the
village. If the owner has not completed the repair in a timely manner, the
village may complete the repair at the expense of the property owner. (Ord.
2009-03, 1-20-2009)
10-4-9: FEES:
   A.   Fee Time Line: All permit fees shall be due when the permit
application/plans have been approved.
   B.   Fee Structure:
 
Permit                     Inspection Fee Connection Fee
Excavation                    --          --
Curb cut:                                 
Curb cut                   $50.00          
     Sidewalk replacem50.00          $15.00/square yard (if performed by
                                          the village)
    Street cut replacem50.00          $15.00/square yard (if performed by
                                          the village)
Utility                    As stated in section
                           9-4-13 of this code
 
(Ord. 2009-03, 1-20-2009)
10-4-10: VIOLATIONS; PENALTIES:
   A.   It shall be a violation of this chapter for any person to knowingly or
with reckless disregard for the truth or veracity make any false statement or
statements in the excavation/utility/curb cut permit application.
   B.   In case of a violation of any provision of this chapter, the applicable
code official may cause to be instituted the appropriate proceeding at law or
in equity to obtain penalties or to restrain, correct or abate such violation,
or to require the removal or termination of an unlawful occupancy of the
structure. The village may take action to abate any violation, and any costs
incurred in abating such violations may be charged against the real estate upon
which such abatement occurs and shall be a lien upon such property.
   C.   Any person who shall violate any of the provisions of this chapter
shall be subject to a fine of not less than fifty dollars ($50.00) nor more
than seven hundred fifty dollars ($750.00) for each violation. Each day upon
which a violation occurs shall be considered a separate and distinct offense.
(Ord. 2009-03, 1-20-2009)
CHAPTER 5
OCCUPANCY PERMITS
SECTION:
10-5-1: Short Title
10-5-2: Purpose And Intent
10-5-3: Definitions
10-5-4: Permit Required; Exemptions
10-5-5: Types Of Permits
10-5-6: Application And Fees
10-5-7: Administration And Review Process
10-5-8: Violations; Penalties
10-5-1: SHORT TITLE:
This chapter shall be known as the OCCUPANCY PERMITS ORDINANCE of the village.
(Ord. 2009-01, 1-20-2009)
10-5-2: PURPOSE AND INTENT:
The purpose of this chapter is to protect the public health, welfare and safety
of the citizens of the village by requiring structures fit or used for
occupancy to be in compliance with the requirements and standards as set forth
in this chapter. (Ord. 2009-01, 1-20-2009)
10-5-3: DEFINITIONS:
OCCUPANCY: Any structure used by any person for living, sleeping, cooking,
eating in or having possession or use of a dwelling unit or rooming unit or any
structure used for industrial or commercial purposes.
OCCUPANCY PERMIT: The certificate or permit, by whatever name denominated,
which the village, under its authority to regulate the construction of
buildings, issues as evidence that there has been compliance with all
applicable requirements, and such permit is required before any new,
reconstructed or remodeled building may be lawfully occupied. (Ord. 2009-01, 1-
20-2009; amd. Ord. 2009-120, 11-2-2009)
10-5-4: PERMIT REQUIRED; EXEMPTIONS:
It shall be unlawful for any person, firm, corporation or any other entity to
occupy, or for any owner or agent thereof to permit the occupancy of, any
building or structure or addition thereto, or part thereof, for any purpose
unless and until an occupancy permit, which shall state that the occupancy
complies with one of the types of occupancy permit provisions of this chapter,
is issued. This section shall not apply to any occupancy or use of structures
in existence prior to February 1, 2009. (Ord. 2009-120, 11-2-2009)
10-5-5: TYPES OF PERMITS:
   A.   Certificate Of Occupancy: A certificate of occupancy may only be issued
if the following requirements have been met:
      1.   The structure has been erected or structurally altered in
conformance with the provisions of this code;
      2.   The structure has been erected or structurally altered in
conformance with all applicable health and building laws;
      3.   The structure has been erected or structurally altered in
conformance with the building permit issued for the structure;
      4.   The lot on which the structure occupies has been approved, filed and
recorded in accordance with the requirements of this code;
      5.   The structure is connected to an appropriate potable or public water
system;
      6.   The structure is connected to an appropriate septic or public sewer
system;
      7.   Final grading has been completed in accordance with the approved
plat;
      8.   Lot areas, including areas between the sidewalks and curbs, have
been stabilized by seeding and mulching;
      9.   A public or private road surface allowing for ingress and egress to
the property and in compliance with this code has been completed and approved
by the village; and
      10.   A driveway surface has been constructed and completed in compliance
with this code.
   B.   Individual Occupancy Permit: An individual occupancy permit may be
issued to multi-tenant commercial buildings or multi-family residential
buildings on a store by store or unit by unit basis if the individual store or
unit has met all the requirements for the issuance of a certificate of
occupancy, except for the requirements of final grading and stabilization of
lot areas by seeding and mulching; however, no such permit shall be issued
unless work on portions of such commercial buildings or residential buildings
has advanced to the point that the individuals using the portions of such
buildings for which the certificates are to be issued will not be endangered by
construction in progress and the building is safe for the area to be occupied.
An individual occupancy permit shall only be valid for six (6) months.
   C.   Temporary Occupancy Permit:
      1.   A temporary occupancy permit may be issued when adverse weather
conditions do not permit for compliance of all of the requirements for the
issuance of a certificate of occupancy. The minimum requirements that must be
met for a temporary occupancy permit to be issued are:
         a.   The structure has substantially been erected or structurally
altered in conformance with the provisions of this code;
         b.   The structure has substantially been erected or structurally
altered in conformance with all applicable health and building laws;
         c.   The structure has substantially been erected or structurally
altered in conformance with the building permit issued for the structure;
         d.   The structure is connected to an appropriate potable or public
water system;
         e.   The structure is connected to an appropriate septic or public
sewer system; and
         f.   A public or private road surface allowing for ingress and egress
to the property and in compliance with this code has been completed and
approved by the village.
      2.   Application for a temporary occupancy permit shall include a
statement covering the items of work to be completed, denoting the reasons for
which the temporary occupancy permit is requested, and certifying that the work
can and will be completed within the duration of the temporary occupancy
permit. A temporary certificate of occupancy shall only be valid for six (6)
months. (Ord. 2009-01, 1-20-2009)
10-5-6: APPLICATION AND FEES:
   A.   Application: In order for a certificate of occupancy or occupancy
permit to be issued, the owner/applicant must submit a completed occupancy
permit application**** and any applicable fees to the village.
   B.   Fees: There shall be a fee of fifty dollars ($50.00) for each type of
certificate of occupancy issued. Fees shall be submitted along with the
completed occupancy permit application. Checks shall be made payable to the
“Village of Heyworth”.
   C.   Reinspection Fee: Should a reinspection fee be imposed pursuant to
Section
10-3-5 of the Building Permit Ordinance in the Village Code, such fee shall be
due prior to issuance of a certificate of occupancy.
(Ord. 2009-01, 1-20-2009; amd. Ord. 2024-21, 4-18-2024)
10-5-7: ADMINISTRATION AND REVIEW PROCESS:
   A.   Administration: The designated administrating official shall administer
the review of the "occupancy permit application" and inspect the applicable
structure and property to determine if the structure and property are in
compliance with this code. (Ord. 2010-38, 10-4-2010)
   B.   Review Process And Issuance Of Permit: Review of the occupancy permit
application and any accompanying plans and specifications shall be completed
within fourteen (14) calendar days of their receipt. Upon review of the
occupancy permit application and applicable structure and property, the
applicable administrating officer shall either: 1) issue the applicable
occupancy permit; or 2) deny the request for occupancy in writing stating the
reason(s) for the denial. If a request for issuance of an occupancy permit is
denied, the applicant/owner may submit a new occupancy permit application and
applicable fees after compliance has been made. (Ord. 2009-01, 1-20-2009)
   C.   Record Of Certificates: A record of all certificates or permits shall
be kept on file in the office of the village clerk, and copies shall be
furnished, upon request, to any persons having a proprietary or tenancy
interest in the building affected. (Ord. 2010-38, 10-4-2010)
10-5-8: VIOLATIONS; PENALTIES:
   A.   It shall be a violation of this chapter for any person to knowingly or
with reckless disregard for the truth or veracity make any false statement or
statements in the occupancy permit application. If a permit is issued in
reliance upon an inaccurate occupancy permit application, the appropriate
administrating official may revoke the occupancy permit issued and post a sign
at the location stating “occupancy prohibited”.
   B.   In case of a violation of any provision of this chapter, the applicable
code official may cause to be instituted the appropriate proceeding at law or
in equity to obtain penalties or to restrain, correct or abate such violation,
or to require the removal or termination of an unlawful occupancy of the
structure. The village may take action to abate any violation, and any costs
incurred in abating such violation may be charged against the real estate upon
which such abatement occurs and shall be a lien upon such property.
   C.   Any person who violate(s) any of the provisions of this chapter, upon
being found guilty, shall be subject to a fine of not less than fifty dollars
One Hundred Dollars ($100.00) nor more than seven hundred fifty dollars
($750.00) for each violation. Each day upon which a violation occurs shall be
considered a separate and distinct offense.
(Ord. 2009-01, 1-20-2009; amd. Ord. 2024-21, 4-18-2024)
CHAPTER 6
STORMWATER MANAGEMENT
SECTION:
10-6-1: Short Title
10-6-2: Purpose And Intent

10-6-4: Administration And Enforcement
10-6-5: Interpretation Of Provisions
10-6-6: Application Of Provisions

10-6-11-4: Wet Bottom Stormwater Storage Areas
